break_in_practice_rules.description: Break in practice is defined as a gap of 12 months or more without active clinical practice

overseas_applicants.description: For applicants currently residing outside Qatar

12_to_18_months.notes: Must demonstrate 3 months recent clinical activity

18_to_24_months.notes: Must demonstrate 6 months recent clinical activity

qatar_residents.description: For applicants currently residing in Qatar (QID holders or family sponsorship)

12_to_24_months.notes: Must complete 3 months supervised practice in Qatar

24_to_36_months.notes: Must complete 6 months supervised practice in Qatar

36_to_60_months.notes: Must complete 12 months supervised practice in Qatar

over_60_months.notes: Must complete 24 months supervised practice in Qatar

maternity_paternity.documentation_required: Birth certificate or official leave documentation

medical_leave.description: Medical leave due to personal health issues

further_education.description: Enrolled in accredited medical education/training program

research_academic.description: Research or academic sabbatical with some clinical component
research_academic.documentation_required: University/institution letter confirming role and clinical component

calculation_notes: Break is calculated from last day of clinical practice to application date
Only qualifying clinical experience counts (see workplace type criteria)
Observership, training without patient care, and administrative roles count as break
Exceptions must be documented and verified

dentists.description: Minimum 12 months general dentistry internship required
